intro: Alectra stricta, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alectra stricta produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
